segment.source: Displays information about the various SFTMIME commands that can be used in Application Virtualization (App-V).
segment.target: Displays information about the various SFTMIME commands that can be used in Application Virtualization (App-V).

segment.source: The command to run, such as ADD, REFRESH, HELP or REMOVE.
segment.target: The command to run, such as ADD, REFRESH, HELP or REMOVE.

segment.source: What the command applies to, such as APP:Default Application.
segment.target: What the command applies to, such as APP:Default Application.

segment.source: Optional parameters for the specified verb and object.
segment.target: Optional parameters for the specified verb and object.

segment.source: Log output to the specified path name.
segment.target: Log output to the specified path name.

segment.source: Displays output in the active console window (default).
segment.target: Displays output in the active console window (default).

segment.source: Displays errors in a dialog box (not valid for queries).
segment.target: Displays errors in a dialog box (not valid for queries).

segment.source: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.
segment.target: For version 4.6, the following option has been added.

segment.source: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.
segment.target: If specified, output is logged to the specified path name in UNICODE format.

segment.source: The verbs described in the following table are supported.
segment.target: The verbs described in the following table are supported.

segment.source: Adds a new application, package, file type association, or publishing server to the App-V Client.
segment.target: Adds a new application, package, file type association, or publishing server to the App-V Client.

segment.source: Changes the configuration of an application, a package, a file type association, or a publishing server.
segment.target: Changes the configuration of an application, a package, a file type association, or a publishing server.

segment.source: Removes applications, packages, file type associations, or servers.
segment.target: Removes applications, packages, file type associations, or servers.

segment.source: Loads a package into the file system cache.
segment.target: Loads a package into the file system cache.

segment.source: Resets your personal settings for an application.
segment.target: Resets your personal settings for an application.

segment.source: Publishes an application shortcut to the user's Start menu, desktop, or other specified location, or can be used to publish the contents of an entire package.
segment.target: Publishes an application shortcut to the user's Start menu, desktop, or other specified location, or can be used to publish the contents of an entire package.

segment.source: Removes the shortcuts and file types for an entire package.
segment.target: Removes the shortcuts and file types for an entire package.

segment.source: Gets a current list of applications, packages, file type associations, or publishing servers.
segment.target: Gets a current list of applications, packages, file type associations, or publishing servers.

segment.source: Removes your personal settings and desktop configurations for one or more applications.
segment.target: Removes your personal settings and desktop configurations for one or more applications.

segment.source: Unloads a package from the file system cache.
segment.target: Unloads a package from the file system cache.

segment.source: Locks the application specified in the file system cache.
segment.target: Locks the application specified in the file system cache.

segment.source: Unlocks the application specified in the file system cache.
segment.target: Unlocks the application specified in the file system cache.

segment.source: For more information about the preceding actions, use the following command:
segment.target: For more information about the preceding actions, use the following command:

segment.source: For example, the following command will display information for the ADD verb:
segment.target: For example, the following command will display information for the ADD verb:
